remarks: If two categories have the same set of objects, morphisms, and compositions, then they have the same Yoneda functor.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jan-2017.)
statement:
hofpropd.1 $e |- ( ph -> ( Homf ` C ) = ( Homf ` D ) ) $.
hofpropd.2 $e |- ( ph -> ( comf ` C ) = ( comf ` D ) ) $.
hofpropd.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. Cat ) $.
hofpropd.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. Cat ) $.
yonpropd $p |- ( ph -> ( Yon ` C ) = ( Yon ` D ) ) $.
